TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was remanded in custody by an order of ORG on suspicion of having committed money laundering while acting in an organised criminal gang .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed . On DATE ORG upheld the decision to remand her in custody .

CARDINAL . Shortly after her arrival in FAC , the applicant was examined by the prison doctor . She informed him that she did not suffer from any illnesses and that she was not taking any special medication .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the prison doctor of pain in the chest area . The doctor diagnosed vegetative neurosis and prescribed the appropriate medication .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE ORG extended the applicant 's detention , referring to the need to conduct further investigations . This decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again complained of chest pain and was placed under observation . On CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE she reported the same symptoms and was prescribed medication .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again extended the applicant 's detention . It referred to the likelihood of a severe sentence of imprisonment being imposed on the applicant . It also relied on the risk that the applicant might tamper with evidence , given the nature of the charges against her and the fact that she had acted in concert with the co - accused . This decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . The applicant submits that in DATE she discovered a lump in her breast during a self - examination . She informed the prison doctor on DATE . The prison doctor confirmed that there was a lump in the applicant 's left breast and sent her to ORG in GPE . During the consultation , which took place on DATE , a doctor confirmed the existence of the lump and ordered that she undergo a mammography .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's detention was subsequently extended on DATE . ORG referred to the reasons previously given .
CARDINAL . The mammography was performed on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused the applicant 's motion for a change of the preventive measure . He considered that according to a cardiologist 's opinion the applicant could be kept in detention pending trial . He also stressed that an expert oncologist had been asked to prepare an opinion on the applicant 's state of health .

CARDINAL . The applicant subsequently again asked for a change of the preventive measure . On DATE the prosecutor considered that since he had not yet received the expert oncologist 's opinion he could not decide on the applicant 's release . However , he stressed that , according to the information provided by the expert , the applicant could , if necessary , be operated on in the surgical ward of the prison hospital .

CARDINAL . The expert oncologist submitted his opinion on DATE . He stated that the lump should be removed and sent for a histopathological examination . He confirmed that the operation could be performed in the surgical ward of the prison hospital . Referring to the opinion , on DATE the prosecutor dismissed the applicant 's motion for a change of the preventive measure .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended the applicant 's detention , referring to the reasons previously given .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant underwent surgery in the prison hospital . She had the lump removed from her breast .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant 's detention was subsequently extended on DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE . The applicant 's appeals against those decisions were dismissed .
CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE the prosecutor considered that there was no reason for the applicant to be released and that she could be treated in the prison hospital .

CARDINAL . On DATE an act of indictment was filed with ORG . The applicant was charged with money laundering committed while acting in an organised criminal gang . The indictment concerned CARDINAL co - accused .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant 's release on bail ( MONEY ) . The court held that keeping the applicant in custody was no longer necessary to ensure the proper course of the proceedings .
CARDINAL . It would appear that the criminal proceedings against the applicant are pending .
CARDINAL . At the time of lodging her application with the ORG the applicant had been detained in the course of criminal proceedings against her .
